H0.text: when was the drinking age set to 21. July 17, 1984

H1.text: when was the drinking age set to 21. October 1, 1988

H2.text: when was the drinking age set to 21. 1976

H3.text: when was the drinking age set to 21. By mid-1988

A4.text: The National Minimum Drinking Age Act of 1984 was signed into law by President Ronald Reagan on July 17, 1984.

A5.text: The National Minimum Legal Drinking Act, written by Senator Frank Lautenberg (D-NJ) and influenced by Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD), required all states to set their minimum purchasing age to 21.
